description._content: Image taken from: Title: "The History of the Island of Guernsey ... from the remotest period of antiquity to the year 1814. Containing an interesting account of the island; its government, civil, military and ecclesiastical; peculiar privileges, customs, etc. With particulars of the neighbouring islands of Alderney, Serk, and Iersey; compiled from the valuable collections of ... Henry Budd ... as well as from authentic documents, etc. [With plates and a map.]" Author: BERRY, William - of the College of Arms Shelfmark: "British Library HMNTS 9506.dd.19.", "British Library HMNTS 188.b.2.", "British Library HMNTS G.1795." Page: 315 Place of Publishing: London Date of Publishing: 1815 Publisher: Longman, Hurst, Rees, Orme & Brown; John Hatchard Issuance: monographic Identifier: 000297872 Note: The colours, contrast and appearance of these illustrations are unlikely to be true to life. They are derived from scanned images that have been enhanced for machine interpretation and have been altered from their originals.
